13 Barnabe
SEint Barnabe þe Apostle &punctelev; þat guod was and hiende
IMartred he was for godes loue &punctelev; in strongue deþe atþenende
After þat ore swete louerd &punctelev; to heouene gan iwende
Þe Apostles precheden cristindom &punctelev; ase he heom gan wit siende
¶ Seint Barnabe isai&yogh; þo &punctelev; þat his bileue nas nou&yogh;t
he turnde sone to þe Apostles &punctelev; and to ore louerd al is þou&yogh;t
Of lond he hadde ane grete feld &punctelev; and he it solde wel faste
to þe Apostles he wende anon &punctelev; and to heore fet þe panes caste
And forsok al þis world[r. worldes] guod &punctelev; and heore felawe bicam
And Imartred he was with heom &punctelev; for loue of cristindam
Sethþe þo seint powel &punctelev; to þe Apostles wende
Þe Apostles ne lefden it nou&yogh;t &punctelev; þat ore louerd him to heom sende
Ake wenden þat he a gylur were &punctelev; so þat hit was longue
For he hadde so luþur man ibeâ€” &punctelev; are huy dorsten him vnder|fongue
¶ Seint Barnabe iknev him ferst &punctelev; so þat he formest brou&yogh;te
Þe apostles in cuthrade with him &punctelev; and in ri&yogh;te þou&yogh;te
And tolde heom hov ore swete louerd &punctelev; bi weye to him cam
And smot him and binam him is si&yogh;t &punctelev; and brou&yogh;te him to cristindom
¶ Sethþe þo fram Ierusalem &punctelev; þe Apostles gonne wende
Forto prechi godes lawe &punctelev; þat so guod is and hende
And to þe londe of Cypre &punctelev; seint Barnabe huy gonne þo sende:[This v. om. in other MSS.]
Ase he wende forth in is wei &punctelev; in one stude he fond
A felau&yogh;schipe of quoynte Men &punctelev; þe wiseste of al þe lond
he spac with heom so quoynteliche &punctelev; ase he bi heom cam
Þat þar nas non of heom alle &punctelev; þat ne wondrede of his wisdam
"Sire sire," seide on of heom &punctelev; þat was of grete fame
"Tel us of &yogh;wannes þou art &punctelev; and &yogh;wat is þi name
And fram &yogh;wannes þou art hidere icome &punctelev; and for &yogh;wuche þingue
Þou comest here into ore lond &punctelev; ich wot for sume tiþingue."
¶ Seint Barnabe þis holie Man &punctelev; fondede in eche pointe
to answerien heom wel quoynteliche &punctelev; for huy weren heomself so quoynte
"Sire," he seide, "þov axest wel &punctelev; and ich ou wulle telle
Barnabe ich am icleoped &punctelev; þe deueles fo of helle
Iesu cristes man ich am &punctelev; þat me gan hidere siende
Fram Ierusalem ich am icome &punctelev; and þus aboute wiende
Forto prechi is holie name &punctelev; þat brou&yogh;te us out of biende
Bileueth on him and &yogh;e worþeth in Ioye &punctelev; euere withoute ende."
he prechede so þis grete men &punctelev; þat huy turnden heore þou&yogh;t
And weren þare to cristindom &punctelev; þoru&yogh; seint Barnabe ibrou&yogh;t
And biliefden on Iesu crist &punctelev; and heore heorte ope him caste
And prechede also of ihesu crist &punctelev; and turnde þut folk wel faste
Seint Barnabe wende him forth &punctelev; and to þe londe of cipre he com
to tuyrne men to ihesu crist &punctelev; and to prechi cristindom
He cam and fond a foul dede &punctelev; þat schendful was to do
Men vrne nakede al aboute &punctelev; and wummen also
Seint Barnabe was þarof aschamed &punctelev; for it was a schenful dede
Þat þe schrewene neren aschamede nou&yogh;t &punctelev; to schewi heore wrechhede
To þe temple he wende anon &punctelev; ope &yogh;wan huy avouweden heore schame
And amansede þat sori temple &punctelev; in ore louerdes name
Anon with þis mansingue &punctelev; al þat on half dachste adovnn
Þoru&yogh; grete wreche of þis temple &punctelev; with gret noyse and soun
Þo þe schrewes isei&yogh;en þe wreche &punctelev; þat so schamelese were
huy bilefden þulke schendfole dede &punctelev; huy ne dorsten nonoþur for fere
þis holie man wende him forth &punctelev; ferrore in þe lond :[MS. londe]
Tymon, þat was an holi man &punctelev; in a stude he fond
Þat in a strong acces was of a feuere &punctelev; and al atþe deþe nei&yogh;
Seint Barnabe ofþou&yogh;te it sore &punctelev; þo he him isei&yogh;
Þe godspelles of seint Mathev &punctelev; with him euere he ber
In a bok; ase god it wolde &punctelev; with him he hadde as þer
Þis bok he leide ope þis man &punctelev; ase he so sijk þer lay
he bicam anon hol and sound &punctelev; ase al þat folk isay,[MS. i isay]
And wende forth with him aboute &punctelev; hol and glad inov&yogh;
And prechede &yogh;eorne of ihesu crist &punctelev; and folk fram sunne drov&yogh;
Of ore swete louerd of heouene &punctelev; seint Barnabe hadde swich grace
Þat, &yogh;if he founde ani sijk man &punctelev; ase he wende in ani place
And he leide ope him þis bok &punctelev; þat so holi and guod was
Of þe godspelles of seint Mathev &punctelev; so strong siknesse non nas
Þat he þoru&yogh; ore louerdes grace &punctelev; ne helde þarof anon
Þareþoru&yogh; he maude mani men &punctelev; to Iesu criste gon
Þoru&yogh; vertue of þis holie Man &punctelev; and of þis holie bok also
Muche fair mi&yogh;thte ore louerd hath &punctelev; in his seriaunz ido
Þis holie man seint Barnabe &punctelev; &yogh;et forþere he wende
And prechede þe giwes faste &punctelev; hore lijf forto amende
Manie he tornede to cristindom &punctelev; and þene holi gost on heom tende
Þoru&yogh; miracles þat he dude &punctelev; and þoru&yogh; grace þat god him sende
¶ Bareu was a luþur giv &punctelev; þat euere weorrede faste
Seint powel and seint Barnabe &punctelev; and cudde it at þe laste
For þo he fond seint Barnabe &punctelev; þat folk to ore louerd so wiende
To þe luþere Iustise of þe lond &punctelev; þe tiþingue he gan siende
Þis holi man was sone inome &punctelev; and to dome ibrou&yogh;t
huy tormenteden him harde and stronge &punctelev; forto torni is þou&yogh;t
Alle manere turmenz huy him duden &punctelev; þat huy mi&yogh;thten on biþenche
huy ne mi&yogh;thten him nou&yogh;t &yogh;eot enes make &punctelev; fram god is þou&yogh;t blenche
¶ Ase huy weren with al heore mi&yogh;te &punctelev; aboute him[al. om.] faste and longue
Forto defouli þis holie man &punctelev; with tormenz harde and strongue
¶ Þe Aumperores o cosin &punctelev; þat of gret power was
Into toune cam þulke time &punctelev; ase it feol bi cas
Þe giwes weren so sore adrad &punctelev; laste he hem binome
Þoru&yogh; strencþe seint Barnabe &punctelev; and ladde him to rome
Ani&yogh;ht huy nomen þis holie man &punctelev; ase he was toraunsed so
And teiden ane rop aboute is necke &punctelev; and knutten him faste þerto
And drowen him out of heore synagoge &punctelev; with seoruwe and pine inov&yogh;
And sethþe also bi þe sweore &punctelev; out atþe &yogh;ate men him drov&yogh;
And mauden aboute him swiþe gret fuyr &punctelev; and barnden him alto nou&yogh;te
his soule wende to þe Ioye of heouene &punctelev; þat he wel deore abou&yogh;te
¶ Þo nomen þe luþere men heore red &punctelev; &yogh;wanne huy mi&yogh;ten atþe laste
his bones þat weren bileft vnbarnd &punctelev; amidde þe .se. to caste
Ake cristine Men þat weren biside &punctelev; stelen to bi ni&yogh;te
And bureden as wel stilleliche &punctelev; with ase gret honour ase huy mi&yogh;te
Nov bidde we &yogh;eorne ihesu crist &punctelev; king of alle kinge
For loue of seint Barnabe &punctelev; þat he us to heouene bringue
